ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
Insight as to how to go about data analysis
Lots of new matlab skill! I was new to coding coming into this course!
Deeper understanding of probability and statistics principles
Appreciation for how useful residuals are to check our models!

In this course, we gain a deep understanding of biomedical data analysis, from math to stats to engineering concepts. In particular, by delving into not just the way in which we conduct analyses but also why we conduct them, ENAS 549 has expanded my excitement about and critical approach to experimental design. From simple Taylor expansions to OLS/WLS to ODEs, this class has undeniably changed how I will use and explore designs and analyses going forward.
Very interesting. Wish I had more time to dedicate to this class, but I had to audit it. Very thorough and important content.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I had a hard time focusing through the length of the lectures, particularly when going over a code or a derivation. The later could be improved by doing the derivations on the board in real time with the class, though it would take a lot more time!

The strength of this course is the joyful material, the fantastic teachers (both prof and TF), and the organization. The weakness is that a lot of different material is covered, so it could be hard to predict the difficulty of each unit. However, the course has support systems in place to mitigate this challenge, including recording each class, posting all lecture notes and code, providing supplementary readings (in really fantastic textbooks!), and providing access to both the professor and TF for questions.
Pace is quite fast. Spent a lot of time rewatching lectures and taking notes. Generally not a fan of classes where information is simply available on a handout and we just read it and move on.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would because I have learnt a lot through this course, and think it was intellectually challenging and rewarding!
Yes, it provided a great overview of key statistical methods in biomedical data analysis.

Yes!! This course stands out because it has both breadth and depth. I would recommend it to any student who wants to understand biomedical data analysis from mathematical, statistical, and engineering perspectives (all in one semester!).
Yes. Everyone in STEM research should take a data analysis course in their relevant fields.
